headline.main: Rescued by a  Bailout, A.I.G. May Sue Its Savior
headline.print_headline: Rescued by Bailout, A.I.G. May Follow a ‘Thank You’ With a Suit

docs.abstract: A lawsuit claims that the rescue by the government deprived A.I.G.’s shareholders of tens of billions of dollars and took private property for public use without appropriate compensation.
docs.snippet: A lawsuit claims that the rescue by the government deprived A.I.G.’s shareholders of tens of billions of dollars and took private property for public use without appropriate compensation.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG NEWS

docs.abstract: A summary of what's on today's editorial page.
docs.snippet: A summary of what's on today's editorial page.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the deadline approaches, states are deciding whether they will run their own exchanges..
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes governors of twenty-three states that have declared they will not set up their own health insurance exchanges, as required by health care reform law, to help individuals and small businesses find affordable health coverage; contends that even though exchanges will be set up by federal government, it would be best if states took on job.
docs.snippet: As the deadline approaches, states are deciding whether they will run their own exchanges..

headline.main: Hints of Taiwan Leading the Way on Same-Sex Marriage in Asia

docs.abstract: The legislature in Taiwan has held its first hearings on same-sex marriage, and senior judges recently asked for advice from the country's constitutional court on whether to legalize the practice.
docs.snippet: The legislature in Taiwan has held its first hearings on same-sex marriage, and senior judges recently asked for advice from the country's constitutional court on whether to legalize the practice.

docs.lead_paragraph: With improving fiscal conditions and redistricting mostly in the rearview mirror, the 2013 Texas legislative session will face pressing policy questions on education, health care and transportation projects.

headline.seo: Texas Legislature Faces a New Set of Priorities
headline.main: New Legislature Faces a New Set of Priorities
headline.print_headline: New Legislature Faces a New Set of Priorities

docs.lead_paragraph: Even though regulators are required by the new health care law to review requests for a large rate increases, many states have not given the overseers any authority to deny or roll back rates that are deemed excessive.

headline.seo: Despite New Health Law, Some See Sharp Rise in Premiums
headline.main: Health Insurers Raise Some Rates by Double Digits
headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Raise Some Rates By Double Digits

docs.abstract: Health insurance companies across country are seeking and winning double-digit increases in premiums for some customers; those being impacted in particular are small businesses and people who do not have employer-provided insurance and must buy it on their own; situation is emerging because many states have not given regulators authority to deny or roll back rates that are deemed excessive.
docs.snippet: Even though regulators are required by the new health care law to review requests for a large rate increases, many states have not given the overseers any authority to deny or roll back rates that are deemed excessive.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: We still can’t seem to figure out what to call two people who act as if they are married but are not. Well, there’s got to be something better than POSSLQ.

headline.seo: Unmarried Spouses Have a Way With Words
headline.main: Unmarried Spouses Have a Way With Words
headline.print_headline: Unmarried Spouses Have a Way With Words

docs.abstract: Many couples living together under one roof, who choose not to marry or cannot marry, do not know what to call their faux spouse; terms some people use like partner and POSSLQ, or 'person of opposite sex sharing living quarters', are considered too inadequate to describe these relationships.
docs.snippet: We still can’t seem to figure out what to call two people who act as if they are married but are not. Well, there’s got to be something better than POSSLQ.

docs.lead_paragraph: An important part of the military budget bill will provide female service members with insurance coverage for abortions in cases of rape and incest.

headline.seo: A Barrier Drops for Military Women
headline.main: A Barrier Drops for Military Women
headline.print_headline: A Barrier Drops for Military Women

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes provision in Pres Obama's military budget bill that will lift statutory ban on giving female service members insurance coverage for abortions in cases of rape and incest; maintains further action is still required to provide military women safe access to abortion.
docs.snippet: An important part of the military budget bill will provide female service members with insurance coverage for abortions in cases of rape and incest.

docs.lead_paragraph: A hospital in Ohio agreed to pay $3.9 million over allegations that doctors billed Medicare for unneeded heart procedures.

headline.main: U.S. Settles Accusations That Doctors Overtreated
headline.print_headline: U.S. Settles Accusations That Doctors Overtreated

docs.abstract: Group of doctors who performed unusually high rates of heart procedures on patients at EMH Regional Medical Center in Ohio agree to pay $541,870 to settle Justice Department accusations that some of the procedures were medically unnecessary; hospital will pay $3.9 million.
docs.snippet: A hospital in Ohio agreed to pay $3.9 million over allegations that doctors billed Medicare for unneeded heart procedures.
